revised_title: Seed Output and Dispersal by Wind: A Study of Wind-Dispersed Plant Species
tldr: This article investigates the relationship between seed output and the efficacy of wind dispersal in various plant species. It provides evidence of a parallelism between seed output and factors that determine the degree of scattering, suggesting that the reproductive capacity of wind-dispersed species tends to prevail through natural selection. The study also highlights the significant wastage of propagules in wind-dispersed species and their vulnerability to adverse habitat conditions.
